00001 /* 
00002  * jcom.send~
00003  * External for Jamoma: remote audio signal communication
00004  * By Tim Place, Copyright © 2007
00005  * 
00006  * License: This code is licensed under the terms of the GNU LGPL
00007  * http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.html 
00008  */
00009 
00010 #include "Jamoma.h"
00011 
00012 /*
00013         The way this should work is that we have a jcom.send object with N inlets and one outlet (dumpout)
00014         When the object receives a 'gettargets' message then it fills a menu via dumpout with all of the targets.
00015         The target is the OSC name of the target module.
00016         
00017         There is then an @target attribute, which is the jcom.in~ that this sends to.  
00018         
00019         The number of inlets are defined by an argument.  We need to check at the time that dsp is started to 
00020         make sure the target actually has the number of audio signals we are sending though...
00021         
00022         QUESTION:
00023         What about Jitter or other 'signals'?  Should they be implemented via a special mode or additions to 
00024         the plain vanilla jcom.send?
00025         
00026         Argument in that case will need to be type-checked: int = number of inputs, symbol = OSCname
00027 */
00028 
00029 // Prototypes
00030 void *send_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00031 void send_free(t_send *x);
00032 void send_assist(t_send *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst);
00033 void send_bang(t_send *x);
00034 void send_int(t_send *x, long value);
00035 void send_float(t_send *x, double value);
00036 void send_list(t_send *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00037 
00038 // Globals
00039 static t_class          *s_send_class;                                  // Required: Global pointer for our class
00040 static t_object         *s_receivemaster_object = NULL; // An instance of the jcom.receivemaster class
00041 
00042 
00043 /************************************************************************************/
00044 // Main() Function
00045 
00046 int main(void)
00047 {
00048         long attrflags = 0;
00049         t_class *c;
00050         t_object *attr;
00051         
00052         jamoma_init();
00053 
00054         // Define our class
00055         c = class_new("jcom.send", (method)send_new, (method)0L, (short)sizeof(t_send), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00056 
00057         class_obexoffset_set(c, calcoffset(t_send, obex));
00058 
00059         // Make methods accessible for our class:
00060         class_addmethod(c, (method)send_bang,                           "bang",                 0L);
00061         class_addmethod(c, (method)send_int,                            "int",                  A_LONG, 0L);
00062         class_addmethod(c, (method)send_float,                          "float",                A_FLOAT, 0L);
00063         class_addmethod(c, (method)send_list,                           "list",                 A_GIMME, 0L);
00064         class_addmethod(c, (method)send_list,                           "anything",             A_GIMME, 0L);
00065     class_addmethod(c, (method)send_assist,                             "assist",               A_CANT, 0L);
00066     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_dumpout,     "dumpout",              A_CANT,0);  
00067     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_quickref,    "quickref",     A_CANT, 0);
00068         
00069         // ATTRIBUTE: name
00070         attr = attr_offset_new("name", _sym_symbol, attrflags,
00071                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_send, attr_name));
00072         class_addattr(c, attr);
00073         
00074         // Finalize our class
00075         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00076         s_send_class = c;
00077         
00078         return 0;
00079 }
00080 
00081 
00082 /************************************************************************************/
00083 // Object Life
00084 
00085 // Create
00086 void *send_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00087 {
00088         long    attrstart = attr_args_offset(argc, argv);               // support normal arguments
00089         t_send  *x = (t_send *)object_alloc(s_send_class);
00090         if(x){
00091                 object_obex_store((void *)x, _sym_dumpout, (object *)outlet_new(x, NULL));
00092 
00093                 if(attrstart > 0)
00094                         x->attr_name = atom_getsym(argv);
00095                 else
00096                         x->attr_name = gensym("jcom.send no arg specified");
00097                         
00098                 attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);                                       // handle attribute args
00099                 
00100                 if(!s_receivemaster_object)
00101                         s_receivemaster_object = (t_object *)object_new(CLASS_NOBOX, gensym("jcom.receivemaster"));
00102         }
00103         return x;
00104 }
00105 
00106 
00107 /************************************************************************************/
00108 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00109 
00110 // Method for Assistance Messages
00111 void send_assist(t_send *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00112 {
00113         if(msg==1)                      // Inlets
00114                 strcpy(dst, "input to dispatch to jcom.receive objects");
00115         else if(msg==2)         // Outlets
00116                 strcpy(dst, "dumpout");
00117 }
00118 
00119 
00120 void send_bang(t_send *x)
00121 {
00122         send_list(x, _sym_bang, 0, NULL);
00123 }
00124 
00125 
00126 void send_int(t_send *x, long value)
00127 {
00128         t_atom a;
00129         
00130         atom_setlong(&a, value);
00131         send_list(x, _sym_int, 1, &a);
00132 }
00133 
00134 
00135 void send_float(t_send *x, double value)
00136 {
00137         t_atom a;
00138         
00139         atom_setfloat(&a, value);
00140         send_list(x, _sym_float, 1, &a);
00141 }
00142 
00143 
00144 void send_list(t_send *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00145 {
00146         object_method(s_receivemaster_object, ps_dispatch, x->attr_name, msg, argc, argv);
00147 }
